info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 4:24PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Churchill County through 515 PM PDT... At 423 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 20 miles south of Stillwater, or 25 miles southeast of Fallon, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, torrential rainfall, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stillwater, Junction U.S 50 And NV 839, Dixie Valley, Sand Mountain Campground, Mount Lincoln, Frenchman and Sand Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
